title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a "DateTime" type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, and an invalid date string (e.g. "55/66/9999") is entered in the "default value" field, the invalid value is accepted. The following definition shows up in the report design: <parameters><scalarparameter name="dateParam1"><property name="dataType">dateTime</property><property name="allowBlank">false</property><property name="format">Unformatted</property><property name="controlType">textbox</property><expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>.
EB: The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss) which is locale independent, to ensure portability.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type "DateTime".
3. In the "default value" field, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999".
4. Verify that the invalid value is accepted and the report definition contains the invalid date string as the default value.
